intro: Miconia coarctiflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered miconia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, showy leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are borne in dense inflorescences. Miconia coarctiflora is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
